intro: Boottia renifolia, commonly known as the kidney-leaved boottia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant has kidney-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of alpine ecosystems. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
